1.verse_text: The most amazing song of all, by King Solomon.

Let him smother me with kisses–his Spirit-kiss divine. So kind are your caresses, I drink them in like the sweetest wine! For your lovely name is 'Flowing Oil.' No wonder the brides-to-be adore you. We will run away together into the king"s cloud-filled chamber. We will remember your love, rejoicing and delighting in you, No wonder righteousness adores you! of the wandering nomads. because of my dark and sinful ways. Where do you lead your beloved ones as I wander among the flocks of your shepherds? Come to the place near the sanctuary of my shepherds. at one of Pharaoh"s finest horses – your earrings and gem-laden necklaces with golden ornaments studded with silver. the sweet fragrance of spikenard like a tied-up bundle of myrrh resting over my heart. henna plucked near the vines at the fountain of the Lamb. You are beauty itself to me. Your passionate eyes are like gentle doves. Our resting place is anointed and flourishing, and balconies of pleasant-smelling pines.

Your presence releases a fragrance so pleasing– over and over poured out. celebrating your every kiss as better than wine. I know I am so unworthy–so in need. Yet you are so lovely! I feel as dark and dry as the desert tents Yet you are so lovely– like the fine linen tapestry hanging in the Holy Place. My angry brothers quarreled with me and appointed me guardian of their ministry vineyards, yet I"ve not tended my vineyard within. where do you feed your flock? to rest in the heat of the day? Why should I be like a veiled woman if you ever lose sight of me, just follow in my footsteps where I lead my lovers. Come with your burdens and cares. let me tell you how I see you– you are so thrilling to me. To gaze upon you is like looking a strong, regal steed pulling his royal chariot. set them ablaze. awakened the night. I will hold him and never let him part. you are so lovely! both handsome and winsome, you are pleasing beyond words. like a green forest meadow bathed in light.
Jerusalem maidens, in this twilight darkness
Won"t you tell me, lover of my soul,
As the king surrounded me at his table,
A sachet of myrrh is my lover,
He is like a bouquet of henna blossoms–
Rafters of cedar branches are over our heads

2.verse_text: I am truly his rose, the very theme of his song. For though the thorns surround you, you remain as pure as a lily, he stands above the sons of men. he looked upon me with his unrelenting love divine. Refresh me again with your apples. Help me and hold me, for I am lovesick! while his right hand holds me close. by the gentle gazelles and delicate deer, skipping in love over the hills that separate us , even to the places where I hide. Arise, my dearest. Hurry, my darling. Come away with me! The rains have soaked the earth The season for singing and pruning the vines has arrived. I hear the cooing of doves in our land, are bursting forth. Let me see your radiant face and hear your sweet voice. those sly little foxes that hinder our relationship. for we delight ourselves in each other. to the holy mountains of separation without me. I"m overshadowed by his love, like a lily growing in the valley! You stand out from all the rest. more than all others. the most fragrant apple tree– Sitting under his grace-shadow, I blossom in his shade, enjoying the sweet taste of his pleasant, delicious fruit, resting with delight where his glory never fades. I am longing for more– yet how could I take more ? I am at rest in this love. that you"ll not disturb my love until she is ready to arise. I know it"s him coming to me– leaping with joy over mountains, to come to me. he is graceful as a gazelle, swift as a wild stag. Now he comes closer, He gazes into my soul, peering through the portal as he blossoms within my heart. I have come as you have asked to draw you to my heart and lead you out. For now is the time, my beautiful one. the bondage of your barren winter has ended, and the season of hiding is over and gone. filling the air with songs to awaken you and guide you forth. breaking forth around you? The early signs of my purposes and plans The budding vines of new life are now blooming everywhere. The fragrance of their flowers whispers, 'There is change in the air.' Arise, my love, my beautiful companion, and run with me to the higher place. For now is the time to arise and come away with me. It was I who took you and hid you up high in the secret stairway of the sky. How beautiful your eyes of worship and lovely your voice in prayer. For they raid our budding vineyard of love to ruin what I"ve planted within you. Will you catch them and remove them for me? We will do it together. and the shifting shadows of fear disappear, turn around, my lover, and ascend Until the new day fully dawns, run on ahead like the graceful gazelle and skip like the young stag over the mountains of separation. Go on ahead to the mountain of spices– I"ll come away another time .
Yes, you are my darling companion.
Suddenly, he transported me into his house of wine–
Revive me with your raisin cakes.
His left hand cradles my head
Listen! I hear my lover"s voice.
The one I love calls to me:
and left it bright with blossoming flowers.
Can you not discern this new day of destiny
For you are my dove, hidden in the split-open rock.
You must catch the troubling foxes,
I know my lover is mine and I have everything in you,
But until the day springs to life

3.verse_text: Night after night I"m tossing and turning on my bed of travail. Why did I let him go from me? How my heart now aches for him, but he is nowhere to be found! seeking until I find him. Even if I have to roam through every street, nothing will keep me from my search. Where is he–my soul"s true love? He is nowhere to be found. So I asked them, 'Have you found him– my heart"s true love?' I found the one I adore! I caught him and fastened myself to him, Now I"ll bring him back to the temple within where I was given new birth– into my innermost parts, the place of my conceiving. by the gentle gazelles and delicate deer, that you"ll not disturb my love until she is ready to arise. in the pillar of the glory cloud? He is fragrant with the anointing oils more fragrant than all the spices of the merchant. the love seat surrounded by sixty champions, the mightiest of Israel"s host, are like pillars of protection. to defend the king and his fiancÃ©e from every terror of the night. out of the finest wood that will not decay. a canopy of golden glory dwells above it. The place where they sit together is sprinkled with crimson. Love and mercy cover this carriage, blanketing his tabernacle throne. The king himself has made it for those who will become his bride. Come and feast your eyes on this king as he passes in procession on his way to his wedding. This is the day filled with overwhelming joy– the day of his great gladness.
So I must rise in search of him, looking throughout the city, refusing to be feeble in my heart again . of myrrh and frankincense –
Then I encountered the overseers as they encircled the city.
Just as I moved past them, I encountered him.
Who is this one ascending from the wilderness
Look! It is the king"s marriage carriage–
The king made this mercy seat for himself
Pillars of smoke, like silver mist–

4.verse_text: Listen, my dearest darling, you are so beautiful–you are beauty itself to me! Your eyes are like gentle doves behind your veil. What devotion I see each time I gaze upon you. I see how you have taken my fruit and tasted my word. Your life has become clean and pure, like a lamb washed and newly shorn. You now show grace and balance with truth on display. speaking mercy, speaking grace. The words of your mouth are as refreshing as an oasis. What pleasure you bring to me! I see your blushing cheeks showing through your veil of tender meekness. I see your inner strength, so stately and strong. You are as secure as David"s fortress. Your virtues and grace cause a thousand famous soldiers to surrender to your beauty. as you nurture those who are yet infants. Until the darkness disappears and the dawn has fully come, in spite of shadows and fears, I will go to the mountaintop with you– and the hill of burning incense. Perfect is your beauty, without flaw within. to come with me as we climb the highest peaks together. from the crest of the glistening mounts and from the summit of our sublime sanctuary, from the lion"s den and the leopard"s lair. With one flash of your eyes I am undone by your love, You leave me breathless– I am overcome by merely a glance from your worshiping eyes, I am held hostage by your love Your love is my finest wine–intoxicating and thrilling. And your sweet, perfumed praises–so exotic, so pleasing. your tongue releases milk and honey, The fragrance of your worshiping love fastened to my heart. A secret spring that no one else can have are you– my bubbling fountain hidden from public view. What a perfect partner to me now that I have you. When I"m near you, I smell aromas of the finest spice, for many clusters of my exquisite fruit now grow within your inner garden. Here are the nine: A well of living water springs up from within you, Awake, O south wind! Breathe on my garden with your Spirit-Wind. Stir up the sweet spice of your life within me. Spare nothing as you make me your fruitful garden. Hold nothing back until I release your fragrance. Come walk with me as you walked Come taste the fruits of your life in me. You are like a sacrifice ready to be offered. opened like the halves of a pomegranate, the mountain of suffering love Yes, I will be your bride . Come with me through the archway of trust. We will look down my beloved, my equal, my bride. for you have stolen my heart. and by the graces of righteousness shining upon you. for I find the promised land flowing within you. surrounds you with scented robes of white. What a beautiful paradise unfolds within you. pomegranates of passion, henna from heaven, spikenard so sweet, saffron shining, fragrant calamus from the cross, sacred cinnamon, branches of scented woods, myrrh, like tears from a tree, and aloe as eagles ascending. like a mountain brook flowing into my heart! with Adam in your paradise garden.
Your lips are as lovely as Rahab"s scarlet ribbon,
Your pure faith and love rest over your heart
Every part of you is so beautiful, my darling.
Now you are ready, my bride,
For you reach into my heart.
How satisfying to me, my equal, my bride.
Your loving words are like the honeycomb to me;
My darling bride, my private paradise,
You are a fountain of gardens.

5.verse_text: I have gathered from your heart, my equal, my bride, I have gathered from my garden all my sacred spices–even my myrrh. I have tasted and enjoyed my wine within you. I have tasted with pleasure my pure milk, my honeycomb, which you yield to me. I delight in gathering my sacred spice, all the fruits of my life I have gathered from within you, my paradise garden. Come, all my friends– feast upon my bride, all you revelers of my palace. Feast on her, my lovers! Drink and drink, and drink again, until you can take no more. Drink the wine of her love. Take all you desire, you priests. but my heart for him stayed awake. I had a dream. I dreamed of my beloved– he was coming to me in the darkness of night. The melody of the man I love awakened me. I heard his knock at my heart"s door as he pleaded with me: Arise, my love. Open your heart, my darling, deeper still to me. Will you receive me this dark night? There is no one else but you, my friend, my equal. I need you this night to arise and come be with me. You are my pure, loyal dove, a perfect partner for me. My flawless one, will you arise? For my heaviness and tears are more than I can bear. How could I take them up again You have cleansed my life and taken me so far. Isn"t that enough? The core of my very being trembled at his touch. How my soul melted when he spoke to me! As I surrendered to him, I began to sense his fragrance– the fragrance of his suffering love! It was the sense of myrrh flowing all through me! And my heart was torn out in longing for him. I sought his presence, his fragrance, but could not find him anywhere. I called out for him, yet he did not answer me. I will arise and search for him until I find him. the overseers stopped me as they made their rounds. They beat me and bruised me until I could take no more. They wounded me deeply and removed my covering from me. if you find my beloved one, please tell him I endured all travails for him. and I will not be turned aside! How could you continue to care so deeply for him? Isn"t there another who could steal away your heart? We see now your beauty, more beautiful than all the others. What makes your beloved better than any other? What is it about him that makes you ask us to promise you this? He shines in dazzling splendor yet is still so approachable– without equal as he stands above all others, His leadership–so pure and dignified as he wears his crown of gold. Upon this crown are letters of black written How beautiful his insights–without distortion. His eyes rest upon the fullness of the river of revelation, flowing so clean and pure. what a man! words that both pierce and heal, words like lilies dripping with myrrh. But he never uses it in anger, for he is always holy, displaying his glory. His innermost place is a work of art– so beautiful and bright. How magnificent and noble is this one– covered in majesty! His ways are the ways of righteousness, based on truth and holiness. None can rival him, He is delightful in every way and perfect from every viewpoint. If you ask me why I love him so, O brides-to-be, it"s because there is none like him to me. Everything about him fills me with holy desire! And now he is my beloved–my friend forever. My life within her will become your feast. I have spent myself for you throughout the dark night. since I"ve yielded my righteousness to yours? I"ve been pierced through by love, outstanding among ten thousand! on a background of glory. Like a lovely garden where fragrant spices grow – No one speaks words so anointed as this one – but all will be amazed by him.
After this I let my devotion slumber,
I have already laid aside my own garments for you.
My beloved reached into me to unlock my heart.
My spirit arose to open for more of his touch.
I opened my soul to my beloved, but suddenly he was gone!
As I walked throughout the city in search of him,
Nevertheless, make me this promise, you brides-to-be:
The way he leads me is divine.
He sees everything with pure understanding.
Looking at his gentle face, I see such fullness of emotion.
See how his hands hold unlimited power!
He"s steadfast in all he does.
Most sweet are his kisses, even his whispers of love.

6.verse_text: O rarest of beauty, where then has your lover gone? We long to see him too. Where may we find him? We will follow you as you seek after him. into his garden of delight, to feast with those pure in heart. and my beloved is fully devoted to me. When I see you in your beauty, More pleasing than any pleasure, more delightful than any delight, you have ravished my heart, stealing away my strength to resist you. I can"t resist the passion of these eyes that I adore. Overpowered by a glance, my ravished heart–undone. For your undying devotion to me shows how you have taken my truth to become balanced and complete. reveal how real your passion is for me, even hidden behind your veil of humility. without equal, beyond compare, the perfect one, the favorite one. Others see your beauty and sing of your joy. Brides and queens chant your praise: 'How blessed is she!' arising as the dayspring of the dawn, fair as the shining moon, bright and brilliant as the sun in all its strength– astonishing to behold as a majestic army waving banners of victory. where the orchards of the king grow and mature. I longed to know if hearts were opening. Are the budding vines blooming with new growth? Has their springtime of passionate love arrived? My divine desire brought me next to my beloved prince, sitting with him in his royal chariot. Dance for us as we gaze upon your beauty. Why would you seek a mere Shulamite like me? Why would you want to see my dance of love? Because you dance so gracefully,

My lover has gone down to the flowerbeds of spices I see a radiant city where we will dwell as one. Even hosts of angels stand in awe of you. Held captive by your love, I am truly overcome! is the most yielded sacrifice. of royal ones who follow me. We were lifted up together! as though you danced with angels!
I am fully devoted to my beloved,
O my beloved, you are lovely.
Turn your eyes from me; I can"t take it anymore!
I could have chosen any from among the vast multitude
But unique is my beloved dove–unrivaled in beauty,
I decided to go down to the valley streams
Then suddenly my longings transported me.
Come back! Return to us, O maiden of his majesty.

7.verse_text: How beautiful on the mountains are the sandaled feet of this one bringing such good news. You are truly royalty! The way you walk so gracefully in my ways displays such dignity. You are truly the poetry of God–his very handiwork. is flowing the fullness of my Spirit– never failing to satisfy. Within your womb there is a birthing of harvest wheat; they are the sons and daughters nurtured by the purity you impart. How gracious you have become! sparkling light for a multitude. Such discernment surrounds you, protecting you from the enemy"s advance. Your thoughts are full of life, wisdom, and virtue. Even a king is held captive by your beauty. it cannot be described as I count the delights you bring to me. Love has become the greatest. stately and secure as you share with me your vineyard of love. I will take hold of you with my power, possessing every part of my fruitful bride. Your love I will drink as wine, and your words will be mine. more than any delight I"ve known before. Your kisses of love awaken even the lips of sleeping ones. and all his desires are fulfilled in me. Come with me to the faraway fields. We will run away together to the forgotten places and show them redeeming love. and see if the budding vines of love are now in full bloom. There I will display my love for you. sending forth their fragrance of spring. The rarest of fruits are found at our doors– the new as well as the old. I have stored them for you, my lover-friend!
Your life stands tall as a tower, like a shining light on a hill. Your revelation eyes are pure, like pools of refreshing – We will discover if their passion is awakened.
Redeeming love crowns you as royalty.
How delicious is your fair beauty;
You stand in victory above the rest,
Now I decree, I will ascend my palm tree.
For your kisses of love are exhilarating,
Now I know that I am for my beloved
Let us arise and run to the vineyards of your people
The love apples are in bloom,

8.verse_text: If only I could show everyone this passionate desire I have for you. If only I could express it fully, no matter who was watching me, without shame or embarrassment. this holy sanctuary you have formed within me. O that I might carry you within me! I would give you the spiced wine of my love, this full cup of bliss that we share. We would drink our fill until . . . while his right hand holds me close. We are at rest in this love. by the gentle gazelles and delicate deer, that you"ll not disturb my love until he is ready to arise. She arises out of her desert, clinging to her beloved. When I awakened you under the apple tree, as you were feasting upon me, I awakened your innermost being with the travail of birth as you longed for more of me. This living, consuming flame than the chains of death and the grave, all consuming as the very flashes of fire Place this fierce, unrelenting fire over your entire being. will never extinguish this flame. Endless floods will be unable to quench this raging fire that burns within you. Everything will be consumed. It will stop at nothing as you yield everything to this furious fire until it won"t even seem to you like a sacrifice anymore. 'Our sister is so immature . What will we do to guard her for her wedding day?' We will build a tower of redemption to protect her. Since she is vulnerable, we will enclose her with a wall of cedar boards. But now I have grown and become a bride, and my love for him has made me a tower of passion and contentment for my beloved. I am now a firm wall of protection for others, guarding them from harm. This is how he sees me–I am the one who brings him bliss, finding favor in his eyes. His caretakers of this vineyard have given my beloved their best. to those who serve my beloved and have watched over my soul. how marvelous that my friends, the brides-to-be, now hear your voice and song. Let me now hear it again. Come quickly, my beloved. Come and be the graceful gazelle with me. Come be like a young stag with me. We will dance in the high place of the sky, yes, on the mountains of fragrant spice. Forever we shall be united as one!
I long to bring you to my innermost chamber–
His left hand cradles my head

Fasten me upon your heart as a seal of fire forevermore. will seal you as my prisoner of love. My passion is stronger from the burning heart of God. made from a multitude of followers. I give all the glory to you. And I will give double honor
My bridegroom-king has a vineyard of love
But as for my own vineyard of love,
My beloved, one with me in my garden,

9.verse_text: What delight comes to the one who follows God"s ways! He won"t walk in step with the wicked, nor share the sinner"s way, nor be found sitting in the scorner"s seat. deeply rooted by the brooks of bliss, bearing fruit in every season of life. He is never dry, never fainting, for God will not defend them. Nothing they do will succeed or endure for long, for they have no part with those who walk in truth. The Lord embraces their paths as they move forward while the way of the wicked leads only to doom.

His passion is to remain true to the Word of 'I AM,' meditating day and night on the true revelation of light. planted by God"s design, ever blessed, ever prosperous. They are like chaff blown away by the wind.
He will be standing firm like a flourishing tree
But how different are the wicked.
The wicked will not endure the day of judgment,
But how different it is for the righteous!

10.verse_text: What delight comes to the one who follows God"s ways! He won"t walk in step with the wicked, nor share the sinner"s way, nor be found sitting in the scorner"s seat. deeply rooted by the brooks of bliss, bearing fruit in every season of life. He is never dry, never fainting, for God will not defend them. Nothing they do will succeed or endure for long, for they have no part with those who walk in truth. The Lord embraces their paths as they move forward while the way of the wicked leads only to doom.

His passion is to remain true to the Word of 'I AM,' meditating day and night on the true revelation of light. planted by God"s design, ever blessed, ever prosperous. They are like chaff blown away by the wind.
He will be standing firm like a flourishing tree
But how different are the wicked.
The wicked will not endure the day of judgment,
But how different it is for the righteous!

He won"t walk in step with the wicked, nor share the sinner"s way, nor be found sitting in the scorner"s seat. deeply rooted by the brooks of bliss, bearing fruit in every season of life. He is never dry, never fainting, for God will not defend them. Nothing they do will succeed or endure for long, for they have no part with those who walk in truth. The Lord embraces their paths as they move forward while the way of the wicked leads only to doom.

His passion is to remain true to the Word of 'I AM,' meditating day and night on the true revelation of light. planted by God"s design, ever blessed, ever prosperous. They are like chaff blown away by the wind.
He will be standing firm like a flourishing tree
But how different are the wicked.
The wicked will not endure the day of judgment,
